skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Count Hertwig usually fights from the saddle of his blood clenched Imperial Griffon, Bloodfeather.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Plagued by an unfortunate incident in his past, the Elector Count of Ostermark fights all the harder to overcome his enemies and restore his reputation. Indeed, in the Mark, few who have seen his victories will even mention the event that transpired so long ago.

effects.description:
Ward save: +10% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -15% for Empire Knights, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Reiksguard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Wolfram is a fussy man, renowned for his methodical approach to warfare. The common folk sees him as someone to look up to.

effects.description:
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units (minimum 1)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Like the land itself, Wolfram Hertwig is proud and resolute, vying to stand strong against all enemies of the Empire.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: "Stuck next to Kislev and Sylvania, a dreary land of fog and rain on the best of days... Why does anyone want to live there?"

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 10% when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ostermark's trade routes have been secured by Count Hertwig's watchful state-troops, making trade between Kislev, Dwarfs and The Empire more secure and profitable.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.

As an elected governing official of the Empire, an Elector Count has the power and authority to raise troops from his home province. In times of need, or if a regiment is being raised by the right individual, the Count may grant his favor to a unit.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

factionEffects.localised_description: The League of Ostermark is a rural province with danger lurking in every corner. All eyes are fixed upon it's borders and watchtowers are garrisoned with stout, practical men. Trolls and Chaos Warbands are an ever-present threat. Greenskins inhabit the World's Edge Mountains. Sylvania is a southern neighbor. But the common folk have someone to look up to. Wolfram Hertwig is a battle-hardened warrior and has many years experience defending his territory.

effects.description: Ward save: +10% for embedded Witch Hunter Heroes

items.colour_text: As a token of friendship, it is tradition for the Elector Count of Ostermark and the ruler of Kislev to exchange gifts. Ostermark's gift is invariably the promise to aid the city of Kislev in times of military need. At present Kislev is controlled by Tzarina Katarin. She has bestowed upon Hertwig a chained necklace with the sigil of her house, said to be woven with the magics of the Ice Queen herself.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The League of Ostermark is a rural province with danger lurking in every corner. All eyes are fixed upon it's borders and watchtowers are garrisoned with stout, practical men. Trolls and Chaos Warbands are an ever-present threat. Greenskins inhabit the World's Edge Mountains. Sylvania is a southern neighbor. But the common folk have someone to look up to.
